adrFormatAddress: 303 W 74th St, New York, NY 10023, USA

originalText.text:
I discovered Lisa in a book "Life is in the Transitions" written by Bruce Feiler. This book gave different accounts of people who faced a massive shift in their lives; whether it was personal, professional, mental, physical, or emotional. Lisa's story intrigued me and seeing how she was a Hypnotherapist I was even more curious. I have had chronic back 'discomfort' for years I have tried just about everything under the sun; from physical therapy, chiropractors, acupuncture, back specialist, yoga, and many more. The difference between all that I tried prior to Lisa is that she opened my eyes to the fact that we design the world in which we want to live in. What I mean by this is that, our mind can literally conjure up what we think. There is a great quote which goes like this "Change your thoughts, change your world" This is what Lisa instills in her patients. The sessions are long but informative and helpful to the overall healing process.

If you want to change your life make the choice to trust Lisa to help you achieve and obtain your goals. Anything and Everything is obtainable through the power of your mind. Lisa will open your eyes to the endless possibilities of your mind. (Plus, she is a wonderful human with a great soul)

originalText.text:
I was experiencing very severe anxiety relating to surgery and anesthesia in the lead-up to my very long-awaited gender affirming surgery. I was truly concerned that I would have a panic attack on the morning of surgery, despite desired ng this surgery so much and for years. I had spoken with the anesthesia team that my surgeon works with as recommended to assuage such anxiety, but the extremely heightened anxiety remained.

On bringing this situation to my doctor, Dr. Houman Danesh, he recommended that I might want to try medical hypnosis and recommended Lisa Ludovici. Dealing with these overwhelming feelings and physical reactions felt paramount to preparing myself for this life-changing event, and going into it how I wanted to, and so I sought her out.

Lisa's kindness, attentiveness and curiosity struck me immediately on first speaking with her, and I felt that these very overwhelming feelings and physical reactions I was dealing with were finally really being taken seriously, and with a look to dealing with them holistically. I was eager to make an appointment and she worked with me to make it happen before my surgery.

My appointment was truly transformative, and I left it able to feel completely differently from how I'd felt before. Lisa worked with me to create a custom audio for self-hypnosis focusing on my specific concerns and circumstances, which gave me great calmness and comfort leading up to the surgery. Things she mentioned in the audio - such as that the first time my doctors inspected my surgical site they'd pronounce it "perfect," even ended up happening for me; and this was amazing to experience.

On the morning of my surgery, I was able to wake up ready and excited for this life changing experience, rather than terrified and having a panic attack as I'd feared I would, and I credit this to Lisa's kindness, attentiveness and skill and certainly also to the utility of medical hypnosis for my situation of very high anxiety relating to surgery and anesthesia. I had even considered and been prescribed an anti-anxiety medication for the morning of surgery that I was able to not need to use. I am now healing well and am continuing to use the skills for rest and self-healing that she imparted to me. Thank you so much, Lisa!

originalText.text:
I did research on the internet for Hypnotherapists and wasn’t finding anyone I felt strongly about calling.  Then I pulled up Lisa Ludovici’s website.  Impressive.  I watched the video on her home page.

I made the call.

Sessions with Ms. Lisa were life changing.  Yes, life changing.

I came to understand how hypnotherapy is the fast-track to healing.  In addition to Ms. Lisa’s expertise, her kindness and sincerity proved healing as well.  Working with her exceeded my expectations.  I trust her completely.  She is now my “go-to”.

originalText.text: Shortly before the year (2020) I underwent a surgery which unfortunately led to an injured trigeminal nerve. Symptoms of this are similar to trigeminal neuralgia which is nicknamed "the suicide disease" for its intense pain. I underwent numerous surgeries, daily narcotics, and years of not chewing solid food due to the complications. After years of hardship, I eventually found my way to Dr. Danesh at Mount Sinai Medical Center, NYC in the year (2021) who referred me to Lisa. I underwent three sessions with Lisa who during our sessions conducted hypnosis sessions as well as offered the tools for self-hypnosis. Lisa encouraged self-healing as well as the will to let go of discomfort and the intertwined personality that had been formed. After our sessions and through following the assignments given, healing began to flourish and discomfort began to subside.As of today December 2023,  as far as my medical situation is concerned, I’ve been doing very well. Minimal discomfort comes and goes, but nothing to the disabling degree it was once at. Have been off medications completely as well as 100% sober since shortly after our sessions came to an end. The detox and withdrawal wasn’t pretty, yet was able to get through all the same. Happy to report that my life in no way shape for form revolves around what transpired and that both mentally, physically and spiritually have been able to detach from the suffering. Hope all is well with you and your’s and glad to see many more clients in need just as I was find their way to you and your support.

originalText.text: Three sessions with Lisa, plus doing the exercises she provided, not only supported me to have a calm and comfortable dental procedure, but also changed my relationship to my own dental/medical history.  I find this, and Lisa, remarkable.  I believe Lisa's understanding of the workings of the subconscious mind, and her practical approach to re-directing the subconscious mind, have fostered a meaningful shift for me and I am grateful that I had the opportunity to work with her.
